name: vinic
text:
I will purchase a signed copy, frame it, and place it in my bathroom.

This is my life , man. Thought processes .

name: fifthsreversed
text: it is a pain, eternally

name: fineoakstructure
text: oh man...jimo...great avatar.  and i obviously am not the kind of person who normally cares about avatars

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TripperDay, kenthegod, SpizzleTrunk, fakedaisies, toyoda)

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I've often heard them called "avatars." Maybe avatars are different, I don't know. I have to admit, I don't really care...as I said above.

His is the cover of a Jim O'Rourke album. It's a good album with a good album cover. I've seen someone else with the cover to his "Halfway to a Threeway" EP cover, as well.

I believe I made my original comment when I had a shitty over-pixelated home made picture. I haven't upgraded much: mine is currently just the cover to the Criterion edition of Days of Heaven . It's a good film.

There you have it.

name: dopamine
text: yeah they are also called avatars. toe-may-toe toe-mah-toe

name: wite_rabit
text: Now, however, you are a bottle of finely aged scotch.

name: tripperday
text: "Avatar" is a far more accurate term. You can call it an icon and people will know what you're talking about, but icons represent files and programs, not people.

name: pogo
text: Yes, I eventually gave up on this, but Assetbarbarians came up with great combos like "avaticon" and "iconatar."

name: ted0phile
text: You're handy with the portmanteaus.

name: pogo
text: Thanks for reminding me and our readers of a cool word.  And nice combination of things in your avaticon, demeaning and yet elevating both the Mouse and the Revolutionary.

name: ted0phile
text:
Was "our readers" meant to sound assholeish and exclusionary?
Thanks for the semi-compliment, anyway.

name: hexjumper
text: I really can't figure out why Molly can't put two plus two together here. She's usually pretty sharp...

name: mashuren
text:
It's my thinking that she put two and two together just fine, she just doesn't care.

If you can't become acclimated to your lover's various odors, you really have no business living together.

name: mikebox
text: Beef is so special because of course he could see this, but focuses instead on himself and how he'll never get laid again.

name: jamers
text: Beef's long gone by the fifth frame. I bet he stayed there after Molly left at least until one, maybe two legs cramped up.

name: flynn
text: My roommate and I used to kind of hotbox the room by keepin the door and windows closed and surprising each other with horrible smells, but i think it started to kind of hurt our friendship so now we have a special spray.

name: bovine
text: christ. thats like something chimps might do.

name: philosophe
text: A comment left by philosophe was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GSurge, SpinyNorman, scraggg, blarghamagarky, Frankreich)

name: skiddyfisk
text: Never before have I laughed harder at the comments than the strip. Bravo.

name: mega_panda
text: I love that she's cool enough to just throw it off as "one of his things" and let it be done at that.

name: junko
text: 5 for a classic phrase - I now often warn others that the bathroom I just left is "not the coolest place in town".

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, pitseleh, Darthemed)

name: anttirt
text: Doesn't anyone else keep a matchbox in the bathroom? Light up a match and wave it around a bit and most of the odor is gone.

name: jackparsons
text: I used to set fire to the toilet paper and watch it swirl down and go out.  Then we got a plastic cushioned seat and I melted it.  Somewhat difficult to splain.

name: spinynorman
text: "I was bored" usually works.

name: invidious
text: If not, at least you're going the George Washington route and coming out with the honest truth.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Yeh, we always have a candle in there. Lifesaver.

name: stereo
text: This does not work well for body odour

name: clever-nickname
text: i dread the day this happens to me and my future girlfriend/fiance.

name: talix18
text: This is one of those Instances.

name: jamb23
text: Beef's bottom lip in the last panel make this. Also the idea of Romeo and Juliet being cut short because of poo.

name: dallovich
text: Yeah Molly, because powdering your nose is ever so important!

name: saru
text:
This being the Internet, I am unsure if you are joking, or merely unaware of the fact that, "I need to powder my nose," is the most common euphemism women use for needing to use the facilities.
Just in case, I'm leaving this comment.

name: slalvation
text: It doesn't really make sense to use that euphemism to your boyfriend who you live with in the 21st century.

name: epicurus
text: I think she's just sort of either using it ironically or it's deeply ingrained in her.

name: charchar
text:
First, I am so sorry I lamed you. My damn touchpad is acting up.

Also, isn't Molly from like, Victorian times? That might explain her reticence.

name: alienlemur
text: I believe she is from the 1600's. I do not have the link to back my claim up.

name: nigelchaos
text: Ever seen Pulp Fiction?

name: tagrineth
text:
20 minutes of that kind of powdering and Molly'd probably be a vegetable by now.

...I wonder how much coke a cat could actually take in before ODing... O_o

name: nigelchaos
text: I'd donate money to that cause for sure! COKE FOR CATS!

name: autrepoupee
text: my experiments concluded : not enough to make it a Party

name: scorpio_nadir
text: He's not doing one of his things, Molly, he did one of his things!

name: peterjoel
text: I haven't read/seen Romeo & Juliet recently but, if I remember correctly, in the first 3 pages Romeo is still hung up on some girl called Rosaline.

name: drskradley
text:
And then he goes and gets Juliet on the rebound, the slut.

Note: It is Romeo, in this case, that I am referring to as a slut.

name: saru
text:
I chubby you for your aid in the fight to drive from English linguistic double standards.
(And Ash icon, and naming your bass Cerberus.)

name: drskradley
text: Damn woman, it's not the coolest place in town! Get the picture!

name: saru
text:
To answer the alt text ("What's with people who always seem to need to sprint in there when you're done?"), this person probably ate/drank at the same time as you (ie, you share meals), and also has a similar speed of digestion or bladder size as you. I think you can do the rest of the math yourself.
Additionally, it could just be a typical reasoning fallacy, wherein the pattern-making animal, through non-rigorous data collection, distinguishes the existence of a non-random trend in what is statistically noise.

name: jlynes
text: Remember the hits, forget the misses.  Just like "psychics".

name: tagrineth
text: Beef's degenerating expression as his thoughts become more and more dire makes this a 5 for me

name: morypcaina
text: did not even notice. but DAYUM.

name: foetus_punch
text: My girlfriend has an incredible sense of smell, and I always take pains to shut the door when I'm done and not let her in. As a fellow Achewood reader, she gets it.

name: pogo
text: Shit humor is shit humor.

name: spinynorman
text: You mean it's awesome?

name: spoon
text:
It's not actually "shit humor". The shitting thing is just the premise. The real humor is in Beef's paranoia and train of thought.

But now I just think you were not serious and all of this is meaningless.

And it hurts my feelings.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
i wish roast beef would just get over himself.


JUST KIDDING! DONT SHOOT!!!

name: greenkoolayd
text: dude, at the time in history that romeo and juliet takes place, everything stunk way worse, anyhow.

name: friartuck
text:
And this is why Roast Beef does not rule the world.
Because he cares how his shit smells.
